comments:
Today, I started the "feature updates" function of my eclipse 2.0 installation. 
It found to updates:

Eclipse Project SDK (Windows) 2.0.1
Eclipse FTP and WebDAV Support 2.0.1

So, I started the update for "Eclipse Project SDK (Windows) 2.0.1" ... after 
downloading several files, the installation failed with the following error:

---------
Problem Occured

Unable to complete action feature "Eclipse Project SDK (Windows)" due to errors.
---------
Details:
---------
Unable to complete action feature "Eclipse Project SDK (Windows)" due to errors.
UNable to complete action for feature "Eclipse Platform" due to errors.
The File "D:\TEMP\eclipse\.update\1033988497711\1033988497716\eclipse4409.tmp" 
is not a valid JAR file. (java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file]
... is not a valid JAR file...
... is not a valid JAR file...
... is not a valid JAR file...
... is not a valid JAR file...
---------

(BTW: I had to retype the content of the details ... this should be 
copy&pasteable ...!)
Christophe, please take a look at this and see if this can affect 2.0.2 as well.

Our updates 2.0 to 2.0.1 was checked so obviously something is different that we
have to figure out first.

1) the error is about the tmp file we download, it may be a bug, or the fact
that there is no space left on device, can you check D:\ space ?
2) can you attach the log file (.log)
3) can you zip up the .config directory and attach it ?

I understand the issue about cut and paste, once the JAR issue is solved, we'll
pass this PR to the UI Team.

There are 19 GigaByte FREE Space on my D: drive. Here's the .log of my eclipse:

-------------

Installed 2.0.0 + webDav 2.0.0
Started feature updates
Selected the two 2.0.1 versions
Install went correctly...

It seems something happen during the download, the log doesn;t show anything
special but the ZIP reading error.
The .config shows the install (2.0.0) was installed and setup properly

we need to trace the execution.
1) copy the .options from org.eclipse.update.core into the eclipse directory
(peer to eclipse.exe)
2) open it and change following lines to set the boolean to true
org.eclipse.update.core/debug=true
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/warning=true
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/install=true
3) start eclipse with -debug and redirect the standard out to a file
eclipse.exe -debug >> log.txt
Use your options when launching eclipse (i.e if you used -data or -vm)
4) reproduce the error and attach log.txt and .log

Txs

Created an attachment (id=2118)
output of eclipse.exe -debug

I followed all yor steps and this time ... it worked! It took about 10 minutes 
to download and install all the JAR files. I tried it several times before (not 
in debug mode) and always the same error. Perhaps this has somthing to do with 
the debug mode? anyway, i attached the log.txt and .log ...

Created an attachment (id=2119)
.log file after debug session

Action taken: fixed issue where we mapped the downloaded file even if it was not
fully downloaded. Now we only presume the file is correct when it is fully
downloaded and written
Action Plan: Fixed
